To

item.title: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:17, topic:2698”]The error is that of memory overflow. Scar is a scripting engine, and it’s written in delphi, which is already phenominal for memory-mis-management.

Try this: When you finish the precanvas, paint it, then dispose of the picture. Freebitmap(integer); I think.

That way you free your image before you being the next render.[/quote]

Who said what now?

Read full topic
item.source: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)

item.title: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

The error is that of memory overflow. Scar is a scripting engine, and it’s written in delphi, which is already phenominal for memory-mis-management.

Try this: When you finish the precanvas, paint it, then dispose of the picture. Freebitmap(integer); I think.

That way you free your image before you being the next render.

Read full topic

item.title: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

Thanks for the time you took reading the script. I tried changing my “precanvas := canvas” to "precanvas := getbitmapcanvas(bitmapfromstring(height,width,’’); but it didnt like it and spat out [Runtime Error] : Exception: Access violation at address 00CE543C. Read of address 07410420 in line 607 in script. You woulnt so happen to know the answer to that one. Btw, I actually was impressed by your engine for two reasons, it looked like you came up with the code by yourself (ive made an engine before in assembler/c++) which is actually rather incredible, and whats even more amazing is that you used code that the typical engines dont (almost all engines are written similarly to that, just the levels of complexity beyond that are just incredable, such as texturing and knowing what order to texture in, and after that knowing which shapes are hidden and dont need drawing.) [br][size=1]Posted at: May 12, 2006, 05:39:33 pm[/size][hr]O and i just remembered, whats even funnier is that delphi comes with an arctangent function. If only he would the next release would implement it. Btw, ive found a somewhat clever way around it, do all your calculations in grads, which can be calculated by finding the differential of pythags theorum. No loops needed there.

Read full topic

item.title: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Well, that’s easy, you wrote your engine with the intent to show me up.

Your engine is better. And you are right, arctangent is not present, and it would be bloody useful, but we don’t have it. Anyways, there’s a misconception as far as 3d graphics go: We are merely providing a lustrous illusion using an Euclidian plane.

I also realized scar is a nastily written scripting engine. Oh, and it’s written in delphi, which handles memory about as well as aryan updates. Anyways, the problem you are having is dealing with your buffering.

Thing is, you’re not. -sigh-
canvas := GetDebugCanvas;
precanvas := canvas;
So you made a pointer canvas, which points to the debug canvas. Your buffer canvas, precanvas, isn’t even a buffer.

All you have done is made a pointer to an existing object (Debug), then duplicated the pointer, or precanvas.

Try this: “precanvas:= GetBitmapCanvas(BitmapFromString(width,height,’’));”

Yep, that creates an actual buffer.

You’re also going to either need to clear, or recreate your buffer each time you generate a frame. Otherwise you’ll paint on top of your previous frame, and it will become more like an acid trip for about .3 seconds when it becomes a useless blob of pixels.

Read full topic

item.title: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

Ok, time for my second contribution to the forum. I like the other 3-D engine, so i made a better one. This one is customizable and wont give the error my last script did. It is also written using correct syntax and spacing, so if you an intermediate programmer you might like to look at for learning purposes. If for some reason you do get an error the first time, try click run again. If that still doesnt work, set height and width to 1. Then move the image window into the top right hand corner, reset the height and width and try again. Hope this works guys, it does for me.

{ *DEAD*'s 3-D engine for SCAR
Ok, I was so impressed by the other cube engine that I decided to make my own, but mine is naturally better (lol).
Unfortunately, due to a lack of needed functions from scar (such as arctangent and factorials) I needed to write
my own. This means its not all that fast (I get 6 fps or so, but thats only calculating 24 verticies). Any way,
this thing is cool. Its my first release, and i know theres still some bugs to be fixed, which more or less occur
when you get really close to or behind an object. Ill do my best to fix this in the future.

ONE LAST THING THAT MAKES MY SCAR 3D ENGINE THE BEST!!!!

Its possible to make your own "world". Under the Define procedure, you will see a whole bunch of arrays and numbers.
The arrays are structured as follows, World --> Object --> Face --> Coordanate. This means for every face, there are
a number of coordanates, for every object there are a number of faces, and the world array is made up of a number of
objects. At the moment, there is only a cube which I have created, but feel free to make your own. Also, you'll have
to set the length of each array using the setarraylength(varable array, lenght) procedure.

INSTRUCTIONS (You probally want to read these)

THIS IS A NON TERMINATING SCRIPT, PRESS Q TO QUIT OR CTRL-F4
Ok now that we know that, here are the controls.
The mouse control the angle at which you look
The AWSD keys are used like in any other game, A = left, W = forward, S = backward, D = right
Finally space makes you go up and control makes you go down.

SETUP

Theres only a few options to toy with here.
height and width are the size of the screen.
sensitivity controls how much the mouse has to move to be reconized.
Finally, zoom the size of the object.

OK HAVE FUN, ENJOY
}


program graphicsengine;

type
    coord = array [0..2] of integer;
    face = array of coord;
    obj = array of face;
const
     height = 300;
     width = 400;
     sensitivity = 20;
     looksensetivity = 0.5;
     zoom = 1000;
var
   world,world2 : array of obj;
   trans : coord;
   rotate : array [0..1] of extended;
   i : array [0..2] of integer;
   canvas,precanvas : tcanvas;
   count,x,y,z,x1,y1 : integer;



procedure define;
begin
     setarraylength(world,1);
     setarraylength(world[0],6);
     
     
///////////////////////////////////
///////////// CUBE ////////////////
///////////////////////////////////
     setarraylength(world[0][0],4);
     setarraylength(world[0][1],4);
     setarraylength(world[0][2],4);
     setarraylength(world[0][3],4);
     setarraylength(world[0][4],4);
     setarraylength(world[0][5],4);

///// Front

     world[0][0][0][0] := -50;
     world[0][0][0][1] := 50;
     world[0][0][0][2] := 1000;
     
     world[0][0][1][0] := 50;
     world[0][0][1][1] := 50;
     world[0][0][1][2] := 1000;

     world[0][0][2][0] := 50;
     world[0][0][2][1] := -50;
     world[0][0][2][2] := 1000;
     
     world[0][0][3][0] := -50;
     world[0][0][3][1] := -50;
     world[0][0][3][2] := 1000;
     
//// Back
     
     world[0][1][0][0] := -50;
     world[0][1][0][1] := 50;
     world[0][1][0][2] := 1100;

     world[0][1][1][0] := 50;
     world[0][1][1][1] := 50;
     world[0][1][1][2] := 1100;

     world[0][1][2][0] := 50;
     world[0][1][2][1] := -50;
     world[0][1][2][2] := 1100;

     world[0][1][3][0] := -50;
     world[0][1][3][1] := -50;
     world[0][1][3][2] := 1100;
     
///// Top

     world[0][2][0][0] := -50;
     world[0][2][0][1] := 50;
     world[0][2][0][2] := 1000;

     world[0][2][1][0] := 50;
     world[0][2][1][1] := 50;
     world[0][2][1][2] := 1000;

     world[0][2][2][0] := 50;
     world[0][2][2][1] := 50;
     world[0][2][2][2] := 1100;

     world[0][2][3][0] := -50;
     world[0][2][3][1] := 50;
     world[0][2][3][2] := 1100;

///// Bottom

     world[0][3][0][0] := -50;
     world[0][3][0][1] := -50;
     world[0][3][0][2] := 1000;

     world[0][3][1][0] := 50;
     world[0][3][1][1] := -50;
     world[0][3][1][2] := 1000;

     world[0][3][2][0] := 50;
     world[0][3][2][1] := -50;
     world[0][3][2][2] := 1100;

     world[0][3][3][0] := -50;
     world[0][3][3][1] := -50;
     world[0][3][3][2] := 1100;
     
///// Right

     world[0][4][0][0] := 50;
     world[0][4][0][1] := 50;
     world[0][4][0][2] := 1000;

     world[0][4][1][0] := -50;
     world[0][4][1][1] := 50;
     world[0][4][1][2] := 1000;

     world[0][4][2][0] := -50;
     world[0][4][2][1] := 50;
     world[0][4][2][2] := 1100;

     world[0][4][3][0] := 50;
     world[0][4][3][1] := 50;
     world[0][4][3][2] := 1100;
     
///// Left

     world[0][5][0][0] := 50;
     world[0][5][0][1] := 50;
     world[0][5][0][2] := 1000;

     world[0][5][1][0] := -50;
     world[0][5][1][1] := 50;
     world[0][5][1][2] := 1000;

     world[0][5][2][0] := -50;
     world[0][5][2][1] := 50;
     world[0][5][2][2] := 1100;

     world[0][5][3][0] := 50;
     world[0][5][3][1] := 50;
     world[0][5][3][2] := 1100;

end;

function fact(i : integer) : integer;
var
   holdi,res : integer;
begin
     holdi := i;
     res := 1;
     for i := 1 to holdi do
     begin
          res := i * res
     end;
     result := res;
end;

function arctan(e : extended) : extended;
var
   count : integer;
   res : extended;
   inv : boolean;
begin
     if(abs(e) > 1)then
     begin
          e := pow(e,-1);
          inv := true;
     end else
     begin
          inv := false;
     end;
     for count := 0 to 6 do
     begin
          res := res + ( ( pow(2,2 * count) * pow(fact(count),2) ) / fact(2 * count + 1) ) *  ( ( pow(e,2*count+1) ) / ( pow(1 + pow(e,2),count + 1) ) );
     end;
     if(inv)then
     begin
          res := 1.5707963267 - res;
     end;
     result := res;
end;

procedure equate;
var
   count : array [0..3] of integer;
begin
     setarraylength(world2, getarraylength(world));
     for count[0] := 0 to getarraylength(world2) - 1 do
     begin
          setarraylength(world2[count[0]], getarraylength(world[count[0]]));
          for count[1] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[count[0]]) - 1 do
          begin
               setarraylength(world2[count[0]][count[1]], getarraylength(world[count[0]][count[1]]));
          end;
     end;
end;

procedure translate;
var
   count : array [0..3] of integer;
begin
     for count[0] := 0 to getarraylength(world2) - 1 do
     begin
          for count[1] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[count[0]]) - 1 do
          begin
               for count[2] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[count[0]][count[1]]) - 1 do
               begin
                    for count[3] := 0 to 2 do
                    begin
                         world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][count[3]] := world[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][count[3]] + trans[count[3]];
                    end;
               end;
          end;
     end;
end;

procedure rot;
var
   count : array [0..2] of integer;
   rotate2 : array [0..1] of extended;
   dist,ang,ele,flatdist : extended;
begin
     rotate2[0] := rotate[0] / (180/pi);
     rotate2[1] := rotate[1] / (180/pi);
     for count[0] := 0 to getarraylength(world2) - 1 do
     begin
          for count[1] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[count[0]]) - 1 do
          begin
               for count[2] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[count[0]][count[1]]) - 1 do
               begin
                    x := world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][0];
                    y := world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][1];
                    z := world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][2];
                    dist := sqrt(pow(x,2) + pow(y,2) + pow(z,2));
                    if(x = 0) then
                    begin
                         x := 1;
                    end;
                    if(y = 0) then
                    begin
                         y := 1;
                    end;
                    if(z = 0) then
                    begin
                         z := 1;
                    end;
                    ang := arctan(x/z) + pi;
                    flatdist := abs(x / sin(ang));
                    ele := arctan(y/flatdist) + pi;
                    ang := ang + rotate2[0];
                    ele := ele + rotate2[1];
                    world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][1] := round( sin(ele) * abs(dist) );
                    flatdist := abs(cos(ele) * dist);
                    world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][2] := round( cos(ang) * flatdist );
                    world2[count[0]][count[1]][count[2]][0] := round( sin(ang) * flatdist );
               end;
          end;
     end;
end;

procedure setup;
begin
     canvas := GetDebugCanvas;
     precanvas := canvas;
     precanvas.Brush.Style:= bsSolid;
     precanvas.Brush.Color:= 16777215;
     precanvas.Rectangle(-1, -1, width+1, height+1);
     precanvas.Pen.Color := 255;
     DisplayDebugImgWindow(width, height);
     
     trans[0] := 0;
     trans[1] := 0;
     trans[2] := 0;
     rotate[0] := 0;
     rotate[1] := 0;
     movemouse(100,100);
     equate;
end;

procedure draw;
begin
     precanvas.Rectangle(-1, -1, width+1, height+1);
     for i[0] := 0 to getarraylength(world2) - 1 do
     begin
         for i[1] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[i[0]]) - 1 do
         begin
              x := world2[i[0]][i[1]][0][0];
              y := -1 * world2[i[0]][i[1]][0][1];
              z := world2[i[0]][i[1]][0][2];
              if(z = 0)then
              begin
                   z := 1;
              end;
              x1 := round( x / z * zoom + width / 2);
              y1 := round( y / z * zoom + height / 2);
              precanvas.moveto(x1,y1);
              for i[2] := 0 to getarraylength(world2[i[0]][i[1]]) - 1 do
              begin
                   x := world2[i[0]][i[1]][i[2]][0];
                   y := -1 * world2[i[0]][i[1]][i[2]][1];
                   z := world2[i[0]][i[1]][i[2]][2];
                   if(z = 0)then
                   begin
                        z := 1;
                   end;
                   x1 := round( x / z * zoom + width / 2);
                   y1 := round( y / z * zoom + height / 2);                   precanvas.lineto(x1,y1);
              end;
              x := world2[i[0]][i[1]][0][0];
              y := -1 * world2[i[0]][i[1]][0][1];
              z := world2[i[0]][i[1]][0][2];
              if(z = 0)then
              begin
                   z := 1;
              end;
              x1 := round( x / z * zoom + width / 2);
              y1 := round( y / z * zoom + height / 2);
              precanvas.lineto(x1,y1);
         end;
     end;
     copycanvas(precanvas,canvas,0,0,width,height,0,0,width,height);
end;

procedure listen;
var
   mx,my : integer;
begin
     getmousepos(mx,my);
     if(mx>100 + sensitivity)then
     begin
          rotate[0] := rotate[0] - looksensetivity;
     end;
     if(mx<100 - sensitivity)then
     begin
          rotate[0] := rotate[0] + looksensetivity;
     end;
     getmousepos(mx,my);
     if(my>100 + sensitivity)then
     begin
          rotate[1] := rotate[1] + looksensetivity;
     end;
     if(my<100 - sensitivity)then
     begin
          rotate[1] := rotate[1] - looksensetivity;
     end;
     movemouse(100,100);
     if(iskeydown(chr(32)))then
     begin
          trans[1] := trans[1] - 10;
     end;
     if(isfunctionkeydown(1))then
     begin
          trans[1] := trans[1] + 10;
     end;
     if(iskeydown('a'))then
     begin
          trans[0] := trans[0] + 10;
     end;
     if(iskeydown('d'))then
     begin
          trans[0] := trans[0] - 10;
     end;
     if(iskeydown('w'))then
     begin
          trans[2] := trans[2] - 10;
     end;
     if(iskeydown('s'))then
     begin
          trans[2] := trans[2] + 10;
     end;
     if(iskeydown('q'))then
     begin
          terminatescript;
     end;
end;

begin
     define;
     setup;
     repeat
           translate;
           rot;
           draw;
           listen;
           wait(10);
     until(false);
end.

Read full topic
item.source: Even better 3-D engine (no seriously check it out)
